work.name: Booking.com
work.summary:
Manage multiple (7 to be exact) Kubernetes clusters: running on AWS nodes; maintained with Kops and custom Python scripts.

Develop CI/CD pipelines: Groovy and Python scripts running on multiple Jenkins instances as well as managing 3rd party CI tools (e.g. TravisCI).

Manage AWS infrastructure as code: Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Packer, etc.

Upkeep and develop infrastructure monitoring and logs: Prometheus, Thanos, Athena, Grafana, ELK stack, self-managed Elasticsearch, AWS Elasticsearch cluster, Datadog, New Relic, etc.

Ongoing work on building a high-security environment together with Application Security Team: integrate 3rd party security tools (Snyk, Checkmarx, Lightspin); build pipelines based on these tools; maintain and ACL network policies.

Develop various dev-tools: K8S production clusters access tool; production RDS access tool and a couple of slack bots.
highlights: Work with a high-load, 200 000+ rpm environment.
Provide 24/7 on-call support for the entire R&D team one week per month.

Redefined logs collection and delivery infrastructure multiple times. From pure ELK with K8S-based components to New Relic Logs (replaced self-managed Elasticsearch) with other components distributed between K8S and standalone AWS ec2 instances with focus on redundancy and cost optimisation. Created a fast and reliable pipeline that bootstraps and deploys components along the way

Participated in eliminating the consequences of Codecov security incident 2021 which included developing the procedure and the code required to change over 200 AWS RDS instances' passwords; rolling over the logs infrastructure, packed with RegExes to catch and remove sensitive data before transmitting it to a 3rd party (New Relic), etc.

Participated in developing and deploying what we call the Multicluster. Haproxy-based solution with a Django backend that is responsible for distributing traffic between multiple Kubernetes clusters. Allows us to scale the number of K8S clusters according to the average load and easily upgrade our infrastructure with zero risk for our Production environment.

work.name: Gett
work.summary:
Back when I joined Gett it was a medium-sized startup with under 200 employees in Moscow, Tel Aviv and London offices combined. Out of those 200 only about 60 people were R&D-related staff.

My task was to provide full technical support to Operations representatives in all three countries. This included serving as a focal point between Product Managers and Ops, creating and managing JIRA issues (be it bugs or feature requests), managing settings change requests as well as actually changing the settings via UI and, later, APIs.

Naturally a lot of tasks had been routine ones and were automated via bash, python, ruby and even visual basic (sic!) scripts.
